meanings.definition: Absorb all the attention or interest of.
meanings.sent1: The exciting story engrosses the children during storytime.
meanings.sent2: The mystery novel engrosses readers from start to finish.
meanings.sent3: The movie was so engrossing that even the popcorn fell silent.
meanings.sent4: The music engrossed her like a warm blanket on a cold night.
meanings.sent5: The painting's vibrant colors and intricate details truly engrossed the viewers.

meanings.definition: Write or transcribe in a large, clear hand.
meanings.sent1: The student carefully engrosses the title on the cover page.
meanings.sent2: The calligrapher engrosses wedding invitations beautifully.
meanings.sent3: The cat tried to engross the note with its paw, leaving ink prints everywhere.
meanings.sent4: Her handwriting engrosses the page like a work of art.
meanings.sent5: The artist engrosses the canvas with flowing strokes of the brush.
